32205af9be8690859c7fdecfa48db1fd (13:38): Mhm.
c01e287596d8d0bf8decfaee9613616a (13:45): that assumes the program is loaded by the user and not as a service
c01e287596d8d0bf8decfaee9613616a (13:45): which would be a stupid way of implimenting it imho
32205af9be8690859c7fdecfa48db1fd (13:45): Yup my problem is, it is loaded as a service.
32205af9be8690859c7fdecfa48db1fd (13:46): Now where in the registry can I load and unload service entries?
c01e287596d8d0bf8decfaee9613616a (13:46): Treval: services are loaded at boot time not when a user logs in
